As it says in the description, PhotoFlare is
similar to PhotoFiltre and I find it quite good
to use. It does most things and I am very
happy with it )
It succeeds where it needs to. Simple daily tasks I find are a breeze in PhotoFlare in comparison to other editors I have tried.
does not reallyhave anough features for me, though very easy to use
This is nice app to do small and simple task.
Fast crop and user friendly interface
You won't be able to use or remove it.
It's the absolute minimal in terms of photo fixes.
Had low expectations, but exceeded them, exactly what I needed. I needed a high quality yet simple and free editor. this was it.

Freezed my PC & now I can't remove it???

Iam not able to uninstall this application

Crashed my machine when I tried to do simple photo edits. Rebooted. Then wouldn't uninstall itself from Ubuntu Software. Ubuntu 20.04 Gnome 3.36.8 3.6 GB RAM Intel® Core™ i3-2100T CPU @ 2.50GHz × 4 . Needed to remove using 'sudo apt purge photoflare'.
exelent . love it
Простой и функциональный, для базовых вещей, типа выделения и прочего, самое оно.

I only need one single function to work:
I want to be able to open a picture, then ctrl+a thyen ctrl+c, then go back to gmail and paste the picture in the mail I was writting.

We are now in 2022, and stil cant get whatr paint did on Windows 98SE.

Today I ended up taking screenshots of the image I opened with photoflare, then open the screenshot with another application to eventualy be able to select all and copy the picture.

This works and brakes every few weeks, most likely for updates I do not need. Is there ANY application on Linux that has the power of opening a jpeg and allows the user to copy the picture with ctrl+a ctrl+c? Because I tried to find one really hard, and I think I am going to install paint with WIne now.

What a pile of garbage.
summary: Breaks every week cant even ctrl+c an image out of the app

description:
this photo editor while it does not have every feature is good if you only want and need a photo editor for basic everyday tasks like resizing images also it does more than resizing or cropping images with a good set of tools if the occassion comes that you need them while being lightweight 
i would recomment it
summary: simple editor for everyday usage with extra functionality

description: force quit every minute...

It says it's for the masses and as such it offers quite a bit of editing functionaliisy. Most of the filter effect and brush settings are canned functionalities but can allow you to be creative with a bit of effort, never the less. The advance brush tool allowed me to create some interesting digital painting effects.

Considering that there are applications in the GnuLinux repositories that call themselves image editors but are not, this one actually makes an effort to bring the function of image editing to the general user. In that sense it's a very promising project and hopefully it will continue to be improved.

If it would let me crop an image without closing it first and then crashing I would give it more stars. 
As things stand 1 star is the best I can do. It did not scratch my car, so there's that I suppose.
summary: Hey! what happened to my image?

description: Good for simples, and fast edits, without the need to open gimp

Coming from MS Image Composer which is super simple, Im not one for multiple layers but this is lacking in many areas. Cant copy paste screen, cant click drag pic on canvas, cant stretch/shrink X or Y axis, once you drop something on the canvas (text etc) thats where it stays-you cant move it over just a bit to finetoon placement. They are on the right track to make a simple app but they need to get an old MS Image Composer for “inspiration and ideas”.
summary: Very basic which I like but needs work

description: A working app wit all the basic photo editing feature
summary: A working app wit all the basic photo editing feature
